Key Match Events: Sikandar Raza scalped three wickets in his four overs.
Babar Azam was packed cheaply on 4.
Blessing Muzarabani cleaned up Mohammad Rizwan on 14.
Shan Masood and Shadab Khan kept the scoreboard ticking before Raza scalped two wickets in consecutive deliveries.
Mohammad Wasim scalped four wickets and Shadab picked three as Pakistan restricted Zimbabwe to 130/8 in 20 overs.
Wesley Madhevere and Craig Ervine dealt in boundaries early.
Haris Rauf provided Pakistan with the first breakthrough and dictated the proceedings.
Shadab and Wasim combined to dismiss four batters in the span of six deliveries.
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan took a strong blow in the race for semifinals as Babar Azam and Co. endured a one-run defeat against Zimbabwe in the Super 12 encounter.
The defeat against India makes the clash against Zimbabwe a crucial encounter as far as the semifinal race is concerned.
If Pakistan goes down against Zimbabwe, the chances of them making to the final four takes a strong blow.
The Pakistan management has received a lot of flak regarding Shaheen Afridi's fitness.
Former Pakistan cricketers Wasim Akram and Waqar Younis, former captain Misbah-ul-Haq, wondered if the pacer was rushed into the action.
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan endured a four-wicket loss against India in their first match at the tournament.
The team is 'feeling the pain and hurt' but the morale is still 'high'.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The weather is expected to be slightly chilly, with temperatures dropping to 15 degree Celsius.
Rains are likely to remain away.
